collection.title: Investment platform Groww launches 'intraday trading' on stocks
collection.content: Investment platform Groww has launched Intraday Trading in its latest update. After introducing stocks in June, Groww has opened over 4.5 Lakh Demat accounts, the company said, adding that the app is emerging as a millennial's favourite for investing. Groww offers paperless account opening, easy-to-use interface, and an all-in-one app making stock investing simple & fast.
collection.author: Roshan Gupta

collection.title: Palaniswami to be AIADMK's CM candidate for TN Assembly election
collection.content: AIADMK coordinator O Panneerselvam on Wednesday announced Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami will be the party's Chief Ministerial candidate for the 2021 Tamil Nadu Assembly election. Palaniswami, who is the joint coordinator, announced the formation of an 11-member steering committee. It will have 6 members from Palaniswami's camp and 5 members from Panneerselvam's camp.
collection.author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

collection.title: Own a car without buying it : Revv Subscriptions
collection.content: You can now drive a new car every month as Revv provides the option to subscribe to your favourite car for 1-36 months with ‚Çπ0 down payment, ‚Çπ0 road tax and without the hassle of maintenance and service. The car will be sanitized and delivered to your doorstep ensuring complete safety for you and your loved ones.
collection.author: Roshan Gupta

collection.title: COVID-19 cases in India cross 67L-mark, recoveries surpass 57L
collection.content: The number of coronavirus cases in India has reached 67,57,131 as 72,049 people tested positive in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The coronavirus death toll in the country has risen to 1,04,555, while 57,44,693 coronavirus patients have been discharged. Out of the total cases, 9,07,883 are active.
collection.author: Daisy Mowke

collection.title: Sapna who married secretly trolled for having 'baby without marriage'; husband reacts
collection.content: Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Choudhary has been blessed with a baby boy with husband Veer Sahu, whom she married secretly in January. After trolls questioned how "baby was born without marriage", Sahu responded, "Why should I give proof of marriage? Is it right to interfere in people's lives?" "I'm not speaking as an artist, but as a family man," Sahu added.
collection.author: Daisy Mowke

collection.title: Rhea granted bail by Bombay HC in drug case, brother Showik's bail plea rejected
collection.content: The Bombay High Court on Wednesday granted actress Rhea Chakraborty bail in the drug case related to Sushant Singh Rajput's death. However, it rejected the bail plea of her brother Showik Chakraborty, who was arrested on September 4. Rhea had been in jail since September 9 after being arrested by the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB).
collection.author: Daisy Mowke

collection.title: Angry with Kapil as he showed pure character like Shaktimaan in poor light: Mukesh
collection.content: Mukesh Khanna, who criticised Kapil Sharma's show, has revealed why he's angry with Kapil. "He had once done a skit featuring 'Shaktimaan'...He was in costume and there was a girl and a bed...'Shaktimaan' moves towards her but gets a call, so he flies away," said Mukesh. "How can they show a pure character like 'Shaktimaan' in such light?" he questioned.
collection.author: Daisy Mowke

collection.title: Compliment or taunt: Fan as Stokes says 'Tyagi runs like Lee, delivers like Ishant'
collection.content: Talking about Rajasthan Royals' 19-year-old fast bowler Kartik Tyagi's bowling action, his teammate and England all-rounder Ben Stokes tweeted, "Tyagi has a run up like Brett Lee and delivers like Ishant Sharma." Responding to him, a fan asked, "Is that a compliment or taunt?" to which Stokes replied, "It's neither, it's an observation."
collection.author: Anmol Sharma

collection.title: 41-60 age group in Mumbai most exposed to COVID-19: 2nd sero-survey
collection.content: The second sero-survey, conducted by BMC, Tata Institute of Fundamental Research and Niti Aayog, found that people in the 41-60 age group in Mumbai were the most exposed to COVID-19. Following the 41-60 age group, people in the 12-24 age group in gated societies and high-rises were the most exposed. The overall COVID-19 seroprevalence is 33.4%, as per the survey.
collection.author: Atul Mishra

collection.title: Iceland Cricket use Dhoni's stumping pic to mock Ponting over mankading
collection.content: Iceland Cricket mocked Ricky Ponting who is against mankading. They shared a picture of MS Dhoni stumping AB de Villiers and wrote what ex-Australia captain's statement would be in that case. "This is so unsporting of Dhoni...Batsman only came out of his crease by a short margin and he didn't mean to," wrote Iceland Cricket jokingly attributing it to Ponting.
collection.author: Anmol Sharma

collection.title: I appeal to all Indians to use 'Brown' instead of 'Mankad': Gavaskar on dismissal
collection.content: Sunil Gavaskar has appealed to all Indians to use 'Brown' instead of 'Mankad' to describe such a dismissal. "When a batsman stays there after edging behind...do we take that player‚Äôs name in similar cases? Why then use Mankad‚Äôs name in this case?" he added. Vinoo Mankad ran Australia's Bill Brown out at non-striker's end before delivering the ball in 1947.
collection.author: Anmol Sharma

collection.title: England all-rounder Chris Woakes blessed with baby girl, shares 1st glimpse
collection.content: England all-rounder Chris Woakes and his wife Amie have been blessed with a baby girl. The 31-year-old shared first glimpse of his second daughter on social media, writing, "Evie Louise Woakes...entered our world on Thursday, October 1, 2020. Mum was amazing and Dad couldn‚Äôt be any prouder of his 3 girls. Laila is over the moon with her little sister."
collection.author: Anmol Sharma

collection.title: Working from home sometimes feels like you are sleeping at work: Nadella
collection.content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella on Tuesday said that working from home "sometimes feels like you are sleeping at work". "Thirty minutes into your first video meeting in the morning, because of the concentration one needs to have in video, you are fatigued," Nadella said. He added online meetings make it difficult to transition from a work mindset to private life.
collection.author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

collection.title: We still have personal relations with BJP leadership: SAD chief
collection.content: Nearly two weeks after Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) quit the BJP-led NDA alliance over the farm laws, SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal on Tuesday said, "We still have personal relationships with them (BJP leadership)... The PM took certain very good decisions also." However, he added that BJP had started ignoring allies since the results of the 2019 Lok Sabha polls.
collection.author: Aarushi Maheshwari

collection.title: Ex-MP CM Kamal Nath, 8 others booked for violating COVID-19 norms
collection.content: Former Madhya Pradesh CM Kamal Nath and eight others were booked on Tuesday for allegedly violating COVID-19 norms during a public meeting in the state. The FIR states that 2,000 to 2,500 people attended the public meeting, despite permission having been granted for a gathering of 100 people with the condition of adhering to COVID-19 norms.
collection.author: Aarushi Maheshwari

collection.title: 2 terrorists killed in encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian
collection.content: Two terrorists were killed by the security forces in an ongoing encounter in the Sugan Zainapora area of Shopian district in Jammu and Kashmir on Wednesday, police said. The encounter started on Tuesday evening. In a similar incident, two terrorists were killed in an encounter with the security forces in the Samboora area of Awantipora on September 27.
collection.author: Apaar Sharma

collection.title: Gir forest guard finds lion on road while going home, 'pleads' to let him go
collection.content: A beat guard at Gujarat's Gir forest encountered a lion in the middle of the road, blocking his path, while he was returning home at night on his bike. In a video, the forest guard can be heard 'pleading' with the lion in Gujarati to let him go home. The lion later gets up and walks into the forest.
collection.author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

collection.title: UP CM gives SIT 10 more days to submit report in Hathras case
collection.content: The Special Investigation Team, which is probing the Hathras incident, has been given 10 more days by Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath to submit its findings in the case, said Awanish K Awasthi, State Additional Chief Secretary, Home Department. The SIT was supposed to submit its report on Wednesday. Earlier, Uttar Pradesh government suspended Hathras SP, DSP, and other officials.
collection.author: Apaar Sharma

collection.title: Man who threatened to cut 12-yr-old's fingers if ransom not paid gets death for his murder
collection.content: A Delhi court awarded death penalty to a 32-year man convicted of killing a 12-year-old boy after kidnapping him in 2009. He sent messages to the boy's father demanding ‚Çπ7 crore ransom. "One of the messages sent by the convict is that if the ransom is not given, one finger will be cut every 15 minutes," the judge noted.
collection.author: Krishna Veera Vanamali

collection.title: Bombay HC defers ‚Çπ1.1 crore defamation suit by Richa against Payal
collection.content: Bombay HC deferred the ‚Çπ1.1 crore defamation suit filed by Richa Chadha against Payal Ghosh and others till October 7, in connection with sexual harassment case against Anurag Kashyap. HC deferred the proceedings as respondents had not been served notices. Richa has alleged that "the acts have resulted in tarnishing her reputation and caused her tremendous stress and mental agony".
collection.author: Atul Mishra

collection.title: Pune division reports decline in COVID-19 positivity rate: Official
collection.content: Pune Divisional Commissioner Saurabh Rao said that Pune division reported a decline in the COVID-19 positivity rate in the last fortnight. "We have sufficient hospital beds and, in Pune too, major hospitals have started reporting a dip in new infections," Rao added. In Pune, Sangli and Kolhapur, the positivity rate is 23%, while in Satara, it stands at 25%
collection.author: Atul Mishra

collection.title: Rajasthan Royals captain Steve Smith fined ‚Çπ12L for slow-over rate
collection.content: A fine of ‚Çπ12 lakh was imposed on Rajasthan Royals captain Steve Smith for maintaining a slow-over rate against Mumbai Indians on Tuesday. Smith was penalised after his side failed to finish their quota of 20 overs on time. According to an IPL release, Smith was fined ‚Çπ12 lakh since this was Rajasthan's first over-rate offence this season.
collection.author: Sumit Josh

collection.title: Facebook bans all QAnon conspiracy accounts across its platforms
collection.content: Facebook on Tuesday termed the QAnon conspiracy theory movement as dangerous and banned all Facebook pages, groups and Instagram accounts related to it. QAnon is a conspiracy theory that says President Trump is fighting Satan-worshipping paedophiles including Democrats and Hollywood celebrities. Facebook had earlier said it would restrict such content, but has now completely banned it.
collection.author: Rishabh Bhatnagar

collection.title: New H-1B visa rules require companies to pay higher wages
collection.content: The Trump administration on Tuesday announced significant changes to the H-1B visa program for high-skilled foreign workers that will require companies to pay them higher wages.  Top administration officials said that the changes were made to protect American jobs during the pandemic. The rules will specifically affect tech companies that long supported H-1B visas.
collection.author: Athira Sasidharan

collection.title: Indian banking system in a better place than when COVID-19 hit: Kamath
collection.content: Former ICICI Bank and Infosys Chairman KV Kamath said India's banking system is in a much better place than when COVID-19 hit. He said the RBI's six-month loan moratorium and private banks' discipline while raising capital themselves helped. He added that the bad loan cleanup over the past five years put the system in a better position to recover.
collection.author: Rishabh Bhatnagar
